Description: Limestone stela bearing nineteen rows of incised hieratic text, inlaid with blue pigment, including the cartouches of Amenhotep III and name of Amenhotep, Son of Hapu.The text is a decree dated to year 31 of Amenhotep III, protecting the people and property of the funerary foundation of Amenhtoep son of Hapu. It was probably composed and inscribed in the 21st Dynasty on the basis of earlier documents. It is one of the earliest known stelae in hieratic.
Curator's comments: Photograph published e.g. T. G. H. James, An Introduction to Ancient Egypt (London BM Press) 1979, p. 90. Publications listed in A. Varille, Inscriptions concernant l'architecte Amenhotep fils de Hapu (BdE 44; Cairo 1944), 67-85. For material parallels see Andrea is McDowell A'n incised hieratic ostracon (Ashmolean HO 655)', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology 81 (1995), 221-225 (1 pl. [ills]).
Associated names: Named in inscription: Amenhotep, Son of Hapu
